messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.
What is one of the key goals for quantum computing by 2029 according to IBM's roadmap?
One key goal for 2029 is to deliver the first fault-tolerant quantum computer.
You are a helpful assistant.
What significant milestone is IBM aiming to achieve by 2027 in their quantum computing roadmap?
By 2027, IBM aims to demonstrate the first example of scientific quantum advantage and a fault-tolerant module.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the role of the Nighthawk processor in IBM's quantum strategy?
The Nighthawk processor, with higher connectivity, will enable the execution of more complex circuits.
You are a helpful assistant.
What technological development is IBM planning to enhance the performance of quantum processors?
IBM plans to improve quantum processors to allow running 7,500 gates on up to 360 qubits.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is a key feature of IBM's strategy to scale quantum computing?
IBM plans to scale fault-tolerant quantum computers to run circuits of 1 billion gates on up to 2000 qubits.
You are a helpful assistant.
How does IBM plan to demonstrate quantum advantage in the near future?
IBM plans to demonstrate quantum advantage using a quantum computer with HPC.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the function of Qiskit Functions in IBM's quantum computing strategy?
Qiskit Functions are developed and deployed to deliver domain-specific applications at utility scale.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is IBM's approach to preparing for future quantum computing advancements?
IBM will demonstrate c-couplers and next generation packaging for fault-tolerant quantum computing with the Loon quantum processor.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the significance of the Cockatoo processor in IBM's quantum plans?
The Cockatoo processor will demonstrate entanglement of two modules using a universal adapter.
You are a helpful assistant.
What new quantum processor is mentioned in the text?
Nighthawk, a new higher-connectivity quantum processor.
You are a helpful assistant.
What scale of quantum circuits will the quantum computer be able to execute in the future?
Quantum circuits at a scale of 10K gates on 1000+ qubits.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the expected capability of the first fault-tolerant quantum computer?
The first fault-tolerant quantum computer will allow execution of 100M gates on 200 qubits.
You are a helpful assistant.
What tools and methods will be provided for exploring quantum advantage?
Tools and methods for exploring quantum advantage on a pre-fault-tolerant quantum computer working alongside HPC.
You are a helpful assistant.
What will users be able to do with the first fault-tolerant quantum computer?
Users will be able to run the next scale of applications unlocking a wider, more complex set of use cases.
You are a helpful assistant.
What innovation is used to develop advanced classical transpilation methods?
AI is used to develop advanced classical transpilation methods.
You are a helpful assistant.
What will Nighthawk, a modular processor with 120 square lattice qubits, allow?
It will allow more complex calculations using the same circuit depth.
You are a helpful assistant.
What will the performance of the Nighthawk processor improve to allow?
It will improve to allow circuits with up to 10,000 gates on up to 1080 qubits.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the expected role of quantum computers running algorithms with billions of gates?
They are expected to enable general applications in security, chemistry, machine learning, and optimization.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the purpose of the new workflow accelerator mentioned in the text?
To streamline execution for a known advantage-scale workflow.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is required to scale fault-tolerant quantum computing to 1 billion gates on up to 2000 qubits?
Scaling fault-tolerant quantum computing to 1 billion gates on up to 2000 qubits will require a new control elections and cryogenics infrastructure.
You are a helpful assistant.
What will extensions of the computation and circuit libraries achieve?
Extensions of the computation and circuit libraries will scale and diversify quantum + HPC workflows across industries.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the future goal beyond the Blue Jay quantum computer?
For the future, we will scale beyond Blue Jay with the development of distributed quantum computing, bringing together the fields of quantum communication and quantum computation.
You are a helpful assistant.
How will the Heron processor be delivered to IBM clients?
The Heron processor will be delivered through the IBM Quantum Platform.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the capability of the Heron processor?
The Heron processor is capable of running 5,000 gates on 133 qubits.
You are a helpful assistant.
What distinguishes the Nighthawk processor in terms of qubit connectivity?
The Nighthawk processor has high qubit connectivity and is capable of running 5,000 gates on 120 qubits.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the capability of the Nighthawk processor with up to three 120-qubit modules?
The Nighthawk processor with up to three 120-qubit modules (360 qubits) is capable of running 7,500 gates.
You are a helpful assistant.
How many gates can the Nighthawk processor with nine 120-qubit modules run?
The Nighthawk processor with up to nine 120-qubit modules (1080 qubits) is capable of running 10,000 gates.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the Starling system and what is its capability?
The Starling system is a modular, error-corrected quantum-centric supercomputer with 200 qubits capable of running 100 million gates.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the capability of the Blue Jay quantum computer?
The Blue Jay quantum computer is capable of running 1 billion gates on up to 2,000 qubits.
